entry.title: 404 bug
entry.content:
say hi to you
1.1 motivation to use a version control system:
• In the ideal world:
○ things develop linearly every new version is an improvement upon the previous version, and no need to backtrack
○ Everyone knows what everyone else is doing
○ In the end, things are simply finished
• In the real world:
○ A new version can be anything between a complete catstrophe and a major breakthrough
○ People do not know what others are doing
○ Keep fixing earlier mistakes…
• What can VCS do:
○ Stores the history using snapshots (commits)
○ Manages snapshots and associated metadata: Naming (tags), comments, dates, authors, etc
○ handle multiple development paths (branches). One of the primary functions of VCS is to allow collaboration
○ VCS functions as a backup
• All in all, Version control systems:
○ keeps track of your files and other output
○ tracks what is created and modified
○ tracks who made the modifications
○ tracks why the modifications were made (if you make good commit comments)
2.1 whay Git：
○ Distributed version control. Open source.
○ Popular, used by many project and people
○ Fast,simple and flexible
